meanings.definition: A person who holds a lease on property.
meanings.sent1: The leaseholder pays rent to the landlord every month.
meanings.sent2: The leaseholder signed a contract to rent the apartment for a year.
meanings.sent3: The leaseholder joked that they were the 'king of the lease'.
meanings.sent4: Being a leaseholder is like being the captain of a rental ship.
meanings.sent5: The leaseholder takes care of the rented property as if it were their own.

meanings.definition: The holder of a lease on property.
meanings.sent1: As a leaseholder, you have the right to live in the rented house.
meanings.sent2: The leaseholder is responsible for maintaining the property in good condition.
meanings.sent3: The leaseholder pretended to be the 'queen of the lease'.
meanings.sent4: The leaseholder's role is like that of a guardian of the leased space.
meanings.sent5: The leaseholder enjoys the benefits of living in the rented home.
